meanings.definition: Not stopping or slowing down; continuous.
meanings.sent1: The unceasing rain made the roads slippery.
meanings.sent2: The unceasing noise from the construction site was bothersome.
meanings.sent3: The unceasing barking of the dog next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: Her unceasing laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The unceasing flow of the river was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.sent1: The unceasing support from her friends helped her through tough times.
meanings.sent2: The unceasing traffic on the highway delayed our journey.
meanings.sent3: The unceasing chatter in the classroom made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: His unceasing dedication to his work earned him a promotion.
meanings.sent5: The unceasing ticking of the clock echoed in the empty room.
